result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A Romel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

No violent contact with victim.
No corporal punishment upon the victim or any child.

Anger management course.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.
*Conditions apply to all counts/case.

records.addlTxt:
As to Counts 1, 2, and 3 as Amended:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

As to Count 1 as Amended:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the Milwaukee County Jail consecutive to Count 2.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years.

As to Count 2 as Amended:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the Milwaukee County Jail consecutive to Count 1.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years.

As to Count 3 as Amended: Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the Milwaukee County Jail Concurrent to Count 1.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-As to Count 1: Serve 45 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Anger management course.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with victim.
-No corporal punishment upon the victim or any child. 
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Defendant Craig A Romel in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Branch 46 for Branch 23. 
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, the Court orders the Information amended as follows: 
Count 1: Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor
Count 2: Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor
Count 3: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor

Defendant Craig A Romel in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Due to lateness of the hour, case is adjourned to branch 23 for Plea & Sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Craig A Romel in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information previously filed. Defense counsel previously received Information, who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense advised the court all discovery has been turned over and offer has been extended. Court ordered all conditions of bail remain in effect. Defense requested case set for Plea and Sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 23 for an Arraignment.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LR unless as approved per Children's Court Orders or the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Craig A Romel in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing.   

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (01-28-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Arraignment scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
